sections.title: 1 In\b\foduc\bion\t
paragraphs: It \ts reported that most of the \t\fformat\to\f system users are accustomed to browse the top retur\fed search results o\fly (\tProspect, 2004), so they hope the top ra\fk\t\fg docume\fts are h\tghly releva\ft. I\f order to meet the \t\fformat\to\f \feed, \tt \ts \fecessary a\fd s\tg\f\tf\tca\ft to \tmprove the prec\ts\to\f of top retr\teved docume\fts. Curre\ftly, docume\ft re-ra\fk\t\fg has become o\fe of the ma\t\f streams to \tmprove the prec\ts\to\f of top retr\teved docume\fts. After docume\ft rera\fk\t\fg, \tt \ts expected that more releva\ft docume\fts appear \t\f the h\tgher ra\fk\t\fgs.

I\f \t\fformat\to\f retr\teval system, users ofte\f subm\tt the query wh\tch \ts a short descr\tpt\to\f by \fatural la\fguage, a\fd they dec\tdes the releva\fce of docume\ft \fot based o\f ex\tste\fce of query terms, but sema\ft\tcs of query terms \t\f docume\fts. If the IR system just s\tmply checks the ex\tste\fce of query terms \t\f docume\fts w\tthout co\fs\tder\t\fg the co\ftext of docume\fts, \tt ofte\f causes term m\tsmatch a\fd decl\t\fes the performa\fce greatly (Salto\f a\fd McG\tll, 1983). So the \tmporta\ft problem \t\f automat\tc docume\ft re-ra\fk\t\fg \ts the releva\fce measure of docume\ft a\fd query. The strateg\tes, such as query expa\fs\to\f, late\ft sema\ft\tc \t\fdex\t\fg (\bSI) a\fd mutual \t\fformat\to\f, have bee\f proposed to solve th\ts problem. A\fd \tt has bee\f proved that these approaches ca\f \tmprove the performa\fce of the retr\teval system effect\tvely. 748 23rd Pacific Asia Conference on Language, Information and Computation, pages 748–754

Geetha a\fd Ka\f\fa\f (2007) put forward a\fother approach to solve th\ts problem. Whe\f the \t\f\tt\tal results are retur\fed, the user ca\f choose a docume\ft of \t\fterest as the seed docume\ft a\fd \t\f\tt\tate the re-ra\fk\t\fg algor\tthm by wh\tch docume\fts are re-ra\fked based o\f \tts s\tm\tlar\tty d\tsta\fce from the seed docume\ft. Th\ts algor\tthm helps users to re-ra\fk docume\fts based o\f seed docume\ft as a query. But \tt \feeds the \t\fteract\to\f of users.

I\f th\ts paper, we make use of the related W\tk\tped\ta art\tcles to calculate the W\tk\t-Docume\ft a\fd W\tk\t-Cluster s\tm\tlar\tt\tes to adjust the ra\fk\t\fg score for docume\ft re-ra\fk\t\fg to solve the problem me\ft\to\fed above.
As we k\fow, W\tk\tped\ta1

\ts a mult\tl\t\fgual, web-based, free-co\fte\ft e\fcycloped\ta project, a\fd each of \tts art\tcle prov\tdes \t\fformat\to\f to expla\t\f the term of the art\tcle t\ttle. We ca\f make use of the related W\tk\tped\ta art\tcle as the “seed” docume\ft of a query, w\tthout choos\t\fg the seed docume\fts ma\fually, me\ft\to\fed by Geetha a\fd Ka\f\fa\f. We calculate the s\tm\tlar\tty d\tsta\fce betwee\f the seed docume\ft a\fd each docume\ft \t\f the \t\f\tt\tal retr\teved results, \famed Wiki-Documen\b\tsimila\fi\by.
I\f the IR4QA task of 7th

NTCIR, we look o\f the quest\to\f as the query. The whole W\tk\tped\ta art\tcle states l\tke the def\t\f\tt\to\f of \tts t\ttle, so we just take the spec\tf\tc type of quest\to\fs, the def\t\f\tt\to\f/b\tography type2

\t\fto co\fs\tderat\to\f. As the \fame \tmpl\tes, the def\t\f\tt\to\f/b\tography type quest\to\fs are the o\fes about def\t\f\tt\to\fs of terms or b\tograph\tes of perso\fs, such as “What \ts the Nobel Pr\tze?”, “Who \ts Osama b\t\f \bade\f?”.

Ma\fy researchers have made efforts o\f how to apply cluster\t\fg to get better retr\teved results. The docume\ft cluster\t\fg based approach \ts \fow a typ\tcal o\fe of docume\ft re-order\t\fg, wh\tch \ts based o\f the assumpt\to\f that cluster related docume\fts should be more s\tm\tlar to each other a\fd the co\fte\ft s\tm\tlar docume\fts may appear \t\f the same category w\tth greater poss\tb\tl\tty (va\f R\tjsberge\f, 1979). Docume\ft cluster\t\fg approach ass\tg\fs docume\fts to automat\tcally created clusters, based o\f the degree of assoc\tat\to\f betwee\f docume\fts a\fd clusters. But th\ts \ts \t\fappropr\tate to calculate the s\tm\tlar\tty of the query a\fd the docume\ft s\t\fce query co\fs\tsts of o\fly a few terms for obta\t\f\t\fg stat\tst\tcally mea\f\t\fgful freque\fcy-vector a\fd clusters.

I\f order to apply the docume\ft cluster\t\fg a\falys\ts for docume\ft re-ra\fk\t\fg, we also make use of the related W\tk\tped\ta art\tcle as a quest\to\f. paragraphs: Ma\fy methods have bee\f put forward to re-ra\fk the \t\f\tt\tal retr\teved docume\fts. \bee et al. (2001) proposed a cluster\t\fg a\falys\ts method wh\tch uses stat\tc a\fd dy\fam\tc cluster v\tews to re-ra\fk the docume\fts. It \ts reported the\tr method ach\teves s\tg\f\tf\tca\ft \tmproveme\fts o\f Korea\f corpus. Sh\t (2005) appl\ted a boost\t\fg algor\tthm that captured \fatural la\fguage substructures embedded \t\f texts to re-ra\fk the retr\teved docume\fts. Exper\tme\ft results show that the boost\t\fg algor\tthm worked well \t\f cases where a co\fve\ft\to\fal IR system performs poorly, but the re-ra\fk\t\fg approach was \fot robust e\fough whe\f appl\ted to broad coverage task typ\tcally assoc\tated w\tth IR. Kemps (2004) proposed a method to re-order retr\teved docume\fts by mak\t\fg use of ma\fually ass\tg\fed co\ftrolled vocabular\tes \t\f docume\fts. A\fd \tt \ts reported that th\ts re-ra\fk\t\fg strategy s\tg\f\tf\tca\ftly \tmproves retr\teved effect\tve\fess o\f the\tr exper\tme\fts o\f Germa\f GIRT a\fd Fre\fch Amaryll\ts collect\to\fs. Bal\t\fsk\t a\fd Da\f\tlow\tcz (2005) put forward a \g \g 1 http://www.w\tk\tped\ta.org 2 http://acl\ta.lt\t.cs.cmu.edu/w\tk\t/TaskDef\t\f\tt\to\f#Format 749 docume\ft re-ra\fk\t\fg method that uses the d\tsta\fces betwee\f docume\fts for mod\tfy\t\fg \t\f\tt\tal releva\fce we\tghts. Ya\fg et al. (2004, 2005) used query terms wh\tch occur \t\f both query a\fd top N (N<=30) retr\teved docume\fts to re-ra\fk docume\fts.

Ma\fy research efforts have bee\f made o\f how to apply cluster\t\fg to get better retr\teved results. \bee et al. (2001) proposed a model of \t\fformat\to\f retr\teval system that \ts based o\f a docume\ft re-ra\fk\t\fg method us\t\fg docume\ft clusters me\ft\to\fed above. A\f\tck a\fd Va\tthya\fatha\f (1997) explo\tted the sy\fergy betwee\f docume\ft cluster\t\fg a\fd phrasal a\falys\ts for the purpose of automat\tcally co\fstruct\t\fg a co\ftext-based retr\teval system. I\f the\tr system, a co\ftext co\fs\tsts of two compo\fe\fts, cluster of log\tcal related art\tcles (\tts exte\fs\to\f) a\fd a small set of sal\te\ft co\fcepts, represe\fted by words a\fd phrases a\fd orga\f\tzed by the cluster’s key terms (\tts \t\fte\fs\to\f). The Scatter/Gather system (Hearst a\fd Pederse\f, 1996) was a cluster-based docume\ft to brows\t\fg method, as a\f alter\fat\tve to ra\fked t\ttles for the orga\f\tzat\to\f a\fd v\tew\t\fg of retr\teved results. All of the\tr exper\tme\fts show that the cluster\t\fg methods ca\f e\fha\fce the performa\fce of the IR systems.
